text: Diplocaulus (meaning "double stalk") was an early amphibian, now extinct. It had a boomerang-shaped head formed by two long bones at the back of the head. It had four short legs, and a short, flattened tail. It was about 3 feet (1 m) long. ==Gallery== File:Diplocaulusdb21.jpg File:Diplocaulus vale21DB.jpg ==References== ==Other websites== *Real Skull category:Fossils category:Amphibians
title: Diplocaulus
